entities.name: French Bulldog
entities.description: French Bulldogs are small, sassy, and make wonderful companions. They are known for their stubbornness and require training from a young age.

entities.name: Training a Puppy
entities.description: Training a puppy involves starting young, finding their motivation, keeping sessions quick and exciting, and being consistent.

entities.name: Start While They’re Young
entities.description: It's best to start training puppies while they are young as they are more eager to learn.

entities.name: Find Their Motivation
entities.description: Puppies are motivated by treats, toys, or affection. Finding what works best for your puppy is crucial for effective training.

entities.name: Keep It Quick & Exciting
entities.description: Training sessions should be upbeat and commands should be given in quick succession to maintain the puppy's interest.

entities.name: Be Consistent
entities.description: Consistency in rewarding good behavior and reprimanding bad behavior is key to successful puppy training.

entities.name: Don’t Leave Your Puppy Unsupervised
entities.description: Puppies should be supervised to prevent them from creating chaos or getting into dangerous situations.

entities.name: Don’t Overwhelm Your Dog
entities.description: Avoid overwhelming puppies by focusing on one or two commands at a time and recognizing their limitations.

entities.name: Don’t Use Harsh & Negative Emotions
entities.description: Using harsh tones can make puppies afraid or resistant. It's important to use a firm but encouraging tone.

relationships.description: French Bulldogs require training from a young age due to their stubborn nature.
Training should start when the puppy is young for better results.
Finding what motivates the puppy is essential for effective training.
Training sessions should be quick and exciting to keep the puppy engaged.
Consistency is crucial in rewarding and reprimanding during training.
Puppies should not be left unsupervised to prevent chaos.
Avoid overwhelming puppies by focusing on a few commands at a time.
Harsh tones should be avoided to prevent fear and resistance.
